alert.note: Alert for Walton (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 11 at 6:58AM EDT until September 11 at 9:15AM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Panhandle Florida, including the following county, Walton. * WHEN...Until 800 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 558 AM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen in the last 1 Hour. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Santa Rosa Beach, Eglin Air Force Base, Freeport, Portland, Grayton Beach, Blue Mountain Beach, Seaside, Seagrove Beach, Rock Hill, New Home, Four Mile Village, Sandestin, Bruce, Gulf Pines, Miramar Beach, Villa Tasso and Inlet Beach. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
